channel.title: How to compile a Java program [via batch]
channel.description:
[center] [b][size=24pt]The Java Compiler![/size][/b] [i][size=12pt]Such an amazing thing...[/size][/i]
I swear.. I see way to many posts out there saying:
[code]"haow to cumpil /w bach file to mak java go work?"[/code] [ul]This is server related. :rolleyes:
[u][b]1. Setting your paths[/b][/u] [list] [li]I. Click "Start", then right-click "My Computer" - like so:[/li][/list] [IMG]http://img179.imageshack.us/img179/9219/98126207.png[/img] [list][li]II. Click "Properties" - a new window should open, if not, too bad:[/li] [/list] [IMG]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/5272/26171699.png[/img] [list] [li]III. Find: "Advanced System Settings" - on W7, it's on the left-hand panel:[/li] [/list] [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/vip505.png[/img] [list] [li]IV. Click on the "Advanced" tab, at the top of the new panel, and then click: "Environmental Variables":[/li] [/list] [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/hsvnnd.png[/img] [list] [li]V. At the top panel: "User variables for: Admin", click NEW, TWICE[/li][/list] [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/244a9au.png[/img]
Add in two of them called CLASSPATH, and PATH. For their paths, C&P this:
[u]CLASSPATH[/u][/ul] [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code] [u]PATH[/u] [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin;[/code]
If you have an earlier or newer version of JDK, replace the [code]jdk1.6.0_22[/code] with your version. If you Java folder is not located in [code]C:\Program Files\[/code] then replace that with your chosen directory.
[hr]
[u][b]2. Making the program[/b][/u] We're going to start off simple... Go to your desktop, and create a new folder, called: "Test" [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/ztg0w0.png[/img]
Like the files I have in my folder, you should make those too.
Make these new files:
[code] client.java build.bat run.bat [/code]
Open client.java and C&P this: [/center] [code] class client { public static void main(String args[]) { System.out.println("Hello World!"); } } [/code] [center]
That just prints [code]Hello World![/code] [hr] [u][b]Compiling & Running[/b][/u] This is probably the easiest part. Yet there's so many people who can't figure it out. :P
[u]Build.bat[/u] [code] @echo off title Building... javac client.java echo Build successfully completed! pause [/code] [u]Run.bat[/u] [code] @echo off title Java Program java client pause [/code]
amirite or amirite? [/center]

@si_force wrote:

But this one has both.

item.title: How to compile a Java program [via batch]
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[center]
[size=24pt]The Java Compiler![/size]
[size=12pt]Such an amazing thing…[/size]

I swear… I see way to many posts out there saying:

"haow to cumpil /w bach file to mak java go work?"

[ul]This is server related. :rolleyes:

1. Setting your paths
[list]
[li]I. Click “Start”, then right-click “My Computer” - like so:[/li][/list]

[list][li]II. Click “Properties” - a new window should open, if not, too bad:[/li]
[/list]

[list]
[li]III. Find: “Advanced System Settings” - on W7, it’s on the left-hand panel:[/li]
[/list]

vip505.png788×291

[list]
[li]IV. Click on the “Advanced” tab, at the top of the new panel, and then click: “Environmental Variables”:[/li]
[/list]

[list]
[li]V. At the top panel: “User variables for: Admin”, click NEW, TWICE[/li][/list]

Add in two of them called CLASSPATH, and PATH. For their paths, C&P this:

CLASSPATH[/ul]

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin;

If you have an earlier or newer version of JDK, replace the jdk1.6.0_22 with your version.
If you Java folder is not located in C:\Program Files\ then replace that with your chosen directory.

[hr]

2. Making the program
We’re going to start off simple…
Go to your desktop, and create a new folder, called: “Test”

ztg0w0.png801×216

Like the files I have in my folder, you should make those too.

Make these new files:

client.java
build.bat
run.bat

Open client.java and C&P this:
[/center]

class client
{  
        public static void main(String args[])
        {
           System.out.println("Hello World!");
        }
}

[center]

That just prints Hello World!
[hr]
Compiling & Running
This is probably the easiest part. Yet there’s so many people who can’t figure it out.

Build.bat

@echo off
title Building...
javac client.java
echo Build successfully completed!
pause

Run.bat

@echo off
title Java Program
java client
pause

amirite or amirite?
[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: How to compile a Java program [via batch]
